  • Deuteronomy 34
1 Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the ordinances, which the Domina your God commanded to teach you, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to possess it-- 2 that thou mightest fear the Domina thy God, to keep all Her statutes and Her commandments, which I command thee, thou, and thy daughter, and thy daughter's daughter, all the days of thy life; and that thy days may be prolonged. 3 Hear therefore, O Israel, and observe to do it; that it may be well with thee, and that ye may increase mightily, as the Domina, the God of thy mothers, hath promised unto thee--a land flowing with milk and honey.

 4 Hear, O Israel: the Domina our God, the Domina is one. 5 And thou shalt love the Domina thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might. 6 And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be upon thy heart; 7 and thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thy house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up. 8 And thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thy hand, and they shall be for frontlets between thine eyes. 9 And thou shalt write them upon the door-posts of thy house, and upon thy gates.   10 And it shall be, when the Domina thy God shall bring thee into the land which She swore unto thy mothers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacoba, to give thee--great and goodly cities, which thou didst not build, 11 and houses full of all good things, which thou didst not fill, and cisterns hewn out, which thou didst not hew, vineyards and olive-trees, which thou didst not plant, and thou shalt eat and be satisfied-- 12 then beware lest thou forget the Domina, who brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
13 Thou shalt fear the Domina thy God; and Her shalt thou serve, and by Her name shalt thou swear. 14 Ye shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples that are round about you; 15 for a jealous God, even the Domina thy God, is in the midst of thee; lest the anger of the Domina thy God be kindled against thee, and She destroy thee from off the face of the earth.   16 Ye shall not try the Domina your God, as ye tried Her in Massah. 17 Ye shall diligently keep the commandments of the Domina your God, and Her testimonies, and Her statutes, which She hath commanded thee. 18 And thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of the Domina; that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest go in and possess the good land which the Domina swore unto thy mothers, 19 to thrust out all thine enemies from before thee, as the Domina hath spoken.   20 When thy daughter asketh thee in time to come, saying: 'What mean the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which the Domina our God hath commanded you? 21 then thou shalt say unto thy daughter: 'We were Pharaoh's bondmen in Egypt; and the Domina brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand. 22 And the Domina showed signs and wonders, great and sore, upon Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all her house, before our eyes. 23 And She brought us out from thence, that She might bring us in, to give us the land which She swore unto our mothers. 24 And the Domina commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear the Domina our God, for our good always, that She might preserve us alive, as it is at this day.
